title: WHIRLING F1 / GORACY KUBEK
description: A dialogue with a kojko cook Gorący Kubek. He doesn't speak a word from your language, but for some reason understands all your questions about disposing the corpse??

dialogueTree.title: Gorący Kubek: "The man nods at you, checks his wat..."
dialogueTree.text: The man nods at you, checks his watch and sighs, "Ai-ai-ai..."

links.title: Logic: "It's late. He's working."
links.text: It's late. He's working.

dialogueTree.title: Gorący Kubek: "The man ponders his cooking utensil..."
dialogueTree.text: The man ponders his cooking utensils and gives you a little nod, acknowledging your presence.

links.title: You: ""I need a fridge to store a corpse.""
links.text: "I need a fridge to store a corpse."

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "The man keeps shaking his head. His..."
links.text: The man keeps shaking his head. His eyes seem sad. Then he starts swiping crumbs off the counter top.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't think he understands, offi..."
links.text: "I don't think he understands, officer... We need to find some other way to make ourselves clear."

links.title: You: ""Wait, what language is he speaking?""
links.text: "Wait, what language is he speaking?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He's from Graad -- a Kojko," the l..."
links.text: "He's from Graad -- a Kojko," the lieutenant informs you.

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "With the mention of the word *Kojko..."
links.text: With the mention of the word *Kojko* the cook starts talking excessively, his hands up in the air again.

links.title: Empathy: "He's happy for some reason."
links.text: He's happy for some reason.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "He's from Graad. People from Graad..."
links.text: He's from Graad. People from Graad don't mind if they're called by their national derogatives. It's okay to call him a *Kojko*.

links.title: You: ""I know, Kim... I know." (Make stab..."
links.text: "I know, Kim... I know." (Make stabbing motions at the meat on the cutting board.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What are you doing?!""
links.text: "What are you doing?!"

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "The cook looks at you doing the cha..."
links.text: The cook looks at you doing the charade and smiles.

links.title: You: "Point towards the fridge."
links.text: Point towards the fridge.

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "The cook says something. It's quite..."
links.text: The cook says something. It's quite animated, but you still don't understand.

links.title: You: ""I need to get the corpse..." (Poin..."
links.text: "I need to get the corpse..." (Point to Kim) "... into the fridge!" (Point to the fridge.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Why am *I* the corpse?!" He turns..."
links.text: "Why am *I* the corpse?!" He turns his eyes to the cook, who gives you both a big bright smile.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Doesn't matter... I don't think he..."
links.text: "Doesn't matter... I don't think he understood us anyway. He wouldn't be smiling if he did."

links.title: You: ""I need to put a dead body in this..."
links.text: "I need to put a dead body in this fridge." (Point to the fridge.)

links.title: Gorący Kubek: ""Ooh!" His eyes light up with under..."
links.text: "Ooh!" His eyes light up with understanding, then instantly grow dark again. "No, no," he shakes his head, "Body no fit fridge. Fridge small."

links.title: You: ""How do you know? Maybe it's a smal..."
links.text: "How do you know? Maybe it's a small body."

links.title: Gorący Kubek: ""No, no." He nods confidently. "I k..."
links.text: "No, no." He nods confidently. "I know."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "He *knows* correctly. It is too sma..."
links.text: He *knows* correctly. It is too small.

links.title: Authority: "Listen to him. This is a man who cl..."
links.text: Listen to him. This is a man who clearly knows about bodies and fridges -- and bodies fitting into fridges.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay, we have our answer. It won't..."
links.text: "Okay, we have our answer. It won't fit. We need a bigger fridge."

links.title: You: ""Okay then.""
links.text: "Okay then."

links.title: Gorący Kubek: ""Mhm." He nods confidently. "I know.""
links.text: "Mhm." He nods confidently. "I know."

links.title: You: ""By the way, we speak Revacholian i..."
links.text: "By the way, we speak Revacholian in Revachol." (Get your Revacholian Nationhood on.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Speak Revacholian?" The lieutenant..."
links.text: "Speak Revacholian?" The lieutenant raises his eyebrows.

links.title: You: ""This man is a foreigner!""
links.text: "This man is a foreigner!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We speak *Suresne*. There is no su..."
links.text: "We speak *Suresne*. There is no such thing as the *Revacholian language*," he sighs. "But don't worry, your message remained clear."

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "The cook is still smoking, ash fall..."
links.text: The cook is still smoking, ash falling from between his fingers. His hands are large and clean.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good thing he didn't understand a..."
links.text: "Good thing he didn't understand a word of your stupidity," he concludes.

links.title: You: ""Speak Revacholian, yes. Not this f..."
links.text: "Speak Revacholian, yes. Not this funky thing he's spurting out here."

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "The cook shakes his head and rattle..."
links.text: The cook shakes his head and rattles off a sequence of undecipherable words. He then returns to his smoking, ash falling from between his fingers.

links.title: You: ""Do you know what's behind that doo..."
links.text: "Do you know what's behind that door?" (Point to the blue door.)

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "He looks up at you, then looks away..."
links.text: He looks up at you, then looks away quickly, shrugging and muttering something to himself.

links.title: Composure: "Shrugging is an international sign..."
links.text: Shrugging is an international sign for: 'No, I don't know what's behind that door'.

links.title: You: ""Leo said you're friends with Mañan..."
links.text: "Leo said you're friends with Mañana. Is that true?"

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "The mention of 'Mañana' gets his at..."
links.text: The mention of 'Mañana' gets his attention. He smiles and delivers a whole slew of unfamiliar words and lively gestures. Then he falls silent again.

links.title: Empathy: "They're friends."
links.text: They're friends.

links.title: You: ""What is in that borscht you're mak..."
links.text: "What is in that borscht you're making there?" (Point to the large pot.)

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "The man says a couple of sentences..."
links.text: The man says a couple of sentences in that strange language of his and then seems to wait for you to speak.

links.title: Rhetoric: "I'm pretty sure he asked you a ques..."
links.text: I'm pretty sure he asked you a question.

links.title: Conceptualization: "He doesn't know your language, you..."
links.text: He doesn't know your language, you can just say something cool in return.

links.title: You: ""Yes." (Nod.)"
links.text: "Yes." (Nod.)

links.title: Gorący Kubek: ""*Barszcz* need…" He looks at the s..."
links.text: "*Barszcz* need…" He looks at the soup, then at you. "More *wódka*?" He picks up a bottle from the shelf.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay, so it's vodka that keeps the..."
links.text: "Okay, so it's vodka that keeps the men happy and in good spirits." He nods. "Clever move by the Union."

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Vodka-borscht! I love it, *bratan*!..."
links.text: Vodka-borscht! I love it, *bratan*! Turn it the fuck up and then ask for some yourself.

links.title: Logic: "Turning it up seems like a dangerou..."
links.text: Turning it up seems like a dangerous idea, honestly. The place is a powder keg.

links.title: You: ""Yes." (Nod and turn your fingers c..."
links.text: "Yes." (Nod and turn your fingers clockwise.) "Turn the *wódka* up."

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "He smiles, nodding vigorously, then..."
links.text: He smiles, nodding vigorously, then pours half a bottle of vodka into the pot. With a whistle he stirs the brew.

links.title: You: ""No! No *wódka*!" (Turn your finger..."
links.text: "No! No *wódka*!" (Turn your fingers counter-clockwise.) "Cut it."

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "The cook gives you a long disappoin..."
links.text: The cook gives you a long disappointed look, then turns the stove off and seems to wait for you to speak.

links.title: You: ""I'll leave the cooking to you." (S..."
links.text: "I'll leave the cooking to you." (Shrug.) "I have business."

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "The cook gives you a long inspectin..."
links.text: The cook gives you a long inspecting look, then shrugs too and seems to wait for you to speak.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Of course! Vodka! Now that makes it..."
links.text: Of course! Vodka! Now that makes it a very very special borscht indeed! Turn it up and then ask for some yourself!

links.title: You: ""No." (Shake your head.)"
links.text: "No." (Shake your head.)

links.title: You: ""Mercury rising." (Run your fingers..."
links.text: "Mercury rising." (Run your fingers through your hair.)

links.title: You: ""Sorry, I don't understand you.""
links.text: "Sorry, I don't understand you."

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "Just one word. Sounds quizzical. Th..."
links.text: Just one word. Sounds quizzical. Then he awaits your answer with his brow arched.

links.title: You: ""Gorący, could I have some of that..."
links.text: "Gorący, could I have some of that brew?"

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "He smiles and nods enthusiastically..."
links.text: He smiles and nods enthusiastically, and, chattering away in his language, ladles some brew into a small thermal cup. Then hands it to you.

links.title: You: ""You wouldn't mind if I were to boi..."
links.text: "You wouldn't mind if I were to boil some boots here, would you?"

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "The man takes another drag of his c..."
links.text: The man takes another drag of his cigarette and shakes his head, smiling widely. It's not clear whether he understood your question.

links.title: Authority: "It doesn't matter -- you're a polic..."
links.text: It doesn't matter -- you're a police officer, you can do anything you want.

links.title: Suggestion: "You can always talk your way out if..."
links.text: You can always talk your way out if things go sour.

links.title: You: ""You've got some impressive pots th..."
links.text: "You've got some impressive pots there."

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "He smiles and bangs his ladle again..."
links.text: He smiles and bangs his ladle against each of his pots in turn.

links.title: Conceptualization: "It's almost like music, especially..."
links.text: It's almost like music, especially with the sounds of assorted dishes boiling and simmering on the stove.

links.title: You: ""I don't think I need anything else..."
links.text: "I don't think I need anything else. Stay masculine!" [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Gorący Kubek: "A thin man is smoking below an exha..."
dialogueTree.text: A thin man is smoking below an exhaust hood, occasionally sipping from his mug. This must be the Whirling's cook.

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "As you step in, he nods towards the..."
links.text: As you step in, he nods towards the table and says something in a completely foreign language. The only words you can make out are 'gorący' and 'kubek'.

links.title: Logic: "It must be his name. Gorący, Gorący..."
links.text: It must be his name. Gorący, Gorący Kubek... Sounds representative.

links.title: You: ""Ah, Gorący! I have some questions..."
links.text: "Ah, Gorący! I have some questions to ask!"

links.title: Gorący Kubek: "The man puts his cup down and repli..."
links.text: The man puts his cup down and replies something, his left hand drawing arcs in the air.

links.title: You: ""Mr. Kubek? I'm here on official po..."
links.text: "Mr. Kubek? I'm here on official police business."

links.title: You: ""Hello, sir. Got time for a few que..."
links.text: "Hello, sir. Got time for a few questions?"

links.title: You: "Ignore him. [Leave.]"
links.text: Ignore him. [Leave.]

links.title: Logic: "Okay, it's definitely not his name...."
links.text: Okay, it's definitely not his name. Whatever you do, please don't call him Gorący Kubek! Please. It's not funny.
